intro: Senecio hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its structure is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Senecio hartwegii is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
